orinoco
Interface Table

public interface Table

A table. Presents a set of methods which accepts client invocation and lays the data out in a predefined column format, automatically handling text wrapping within columns and page break. After every page break, the table headings (if specified) will be re-written to the document

              throws java.io.IOException
Adds a new row consisting of empty cells

addCells

public void addCells(java.lang.String[] data)
              throws java.io.IOException
Adds cells to the table, but doesn't write out the row

Parameters:
data - the array of strings which are seuentially written out to each colulmn
Throws:
java.io.IOException

addRow

public void addRow(java.lang.String[] data)
            throws java.io.IOException
Adds a row to the table, consisting of the specified strings, and writes it out. Equivalent to performing sequential calls to addCells and writeRow

Parameters:
data - the array of strings to be sequentially placed in each column
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getCellWriter

public TextWriter getCellWriter(int col)
Gets a writer for the specified cell, allowing more complex text to be written to a cell, including fonts etc.

Parameters:
col - the column number of the row to be written
Returns:
a writer which writes to the specified cell

getCellWriter

public TextWriter getCellWriter(int col,
                                int colspan)
Gets a writer for the specified cell, which spans several columns. The span parameter specifies the number of columns the cell data will span, including the name column

Parameters:
col - the zero-based column index
colspan - the number of columns this text writer will span
Returns:
the cell writer

hasRows

public boolean hasRows()
Indicates whether or not this tables has had any rows added to it

Returns:
TRUE if this table is not empty, FALSE if it is

setBackground

public void setBackground(Colour c)
Sets the background colour for the current row. This will only affect the current row - subsequent rows will have the default background unless setBackground is called again

Parameters:
c - the background colour for the current row

setBorder

public void setBorder(int ps)
The border to be drawn around the entire table when it is closed. The border is also drawn at each page break

Parameters:
ps - the width of the border
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setColumnBorder

public void setColumnBorder(int ps)
                     throws java.io.IOException
The border to be drawn in between each column. Setting a column is incompatible with row spans, as any spanned rows will be dissected by the column

Parameters:
ps - the width of the border
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setColumnSpacing

public void setColumnSpacing(double amount)
Sets the horizontal spacing between columns for all subsequent rows

Parameters:
amount - the space in cm

setHeaderBackground

public void setHeaderBackground(Colour c)
Sets the background colour for the column headings

Parameters:
c - the background colour for the headings

setHeaderBorder

public void setHeaderBorder(int top,
                            int bottom)
                     throws java.io.IOException
The border to be placed around the table heading only. If the row border has been set, then the values set as a result of this method will be ignored

Parameters:
top - the width of the border at the top of the table headings
bottom - the width of the border at the bottom of the heading
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setRowBorder

public void setRowBorder(int ps)
                  throws java.io.IOException
The border to be drawn after each row is written. This is equivalent to a client call to drawline after each row has been written

Parameters:
ps - the width of the border
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setRowSpacing

public void setRowSpacing(double amount)
Sets the vertical spacing for all subsequent rows

Parameters:
amount - the space in cm

setWriteHeadingsIfEmpty

public void setWriteHeadingsIfEmpty(boolean write)
Sets a flag to write the headings, even when the table is empty. Default value is FALSE

space

public void space(double amount)
           throws java.io.IOException
Increases the y position by the specified number of cms Used for small gaps eg. between a row and an underlining Any pending row is ejected first

Parameters:
amount - the amount of vertical space in cms
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeRow

public void writeRow()
              throws java.io.IOException
Writes out the cells in the current row

Throws:
java.io.IOException
